page.title: 06FARMING THE SHREWLEY AREA
page.content: Poultry Farming A poultry farm is situated near Five Ways cafe.It is its eighth year in production, and employs 40 labourers.It has 12 contract sites around Britain. They buy some chicks at two days old and they breed others to be slaughtered at seven weeks. The chickens are dist- ributed locally and nationally by 6 lorries, 3 vans and 5 cars owned by the farm. Dairy Farming All dairy farmers have to go by the EEC milk quota. This means that farmers have to reduce their cattle numbers. Some farmers are given special permission by the M.M.B. If the farmer produces one litre over the milk quota he will be fined 17 pence. Crop Farming There was also a considerable amount of wheat and barley grown locally.
